scripts/file_crawler.py
00001 #!/usr/bin/python
00002 
00003 import argparse
00004 import sys
00005 import ROOT as r
00006 
00007 def main() : 
00008    
00009     # Parse all command line arguments using the argparse module
00010     parser = argparse.ArgumentParser(description='')
00011     parser.add_argument("-l", "--file_list", 
00012                         help="List of files to crawl.")
00013     parser.add_argument("-t", "--tree_name", 
00014                         help="Name of the ROOT tree to crawl.")
00015     args = parser.parse_args()
00016 
00017     if not args.file_list: 
00018         print 'Please specify a list of files to process.'
00019         sys.exit(2)
00020    
00021     f = open(args.file_list, 'r')
00022 
00023     total_entries = 0
00024     for root_file_path in f: 
00025         print 'Crawling file ' + root_file_path.rstrip()
00026         root_file = r.TFile(root_file_path.rstrip())
00027         tree = root_file.Get(args.tree_name)
00028         total_entries += tree.GetEntries()
00029         root_file.Close()
00030         
00031     print "Total number of entries %s" % total_entries
00032 
00033 if __name__ == "__main__":
00034     main()
